title: French parliament adopts government's immigration bill
description: The controversial immigration bill spearheaded by Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin was adopted with a large majority of 349 votes for and 186 against.

title: 'I thought we wouldn't make it': Former Hamas hostages share their stories from northeast Thailand
description: In the impoverished region of Isan, three former farm workers who were abducted by Hamas on October 7 and released 48 days later in exchange for Palestinian prisoners, share the story of their captivity. Two of them temporarily became monks to thank Buddha.

title: French serial killer's ex-wife sentenced to life in prison for participation in three murders
description: Monique Olivier, 75, ex-wife of Michel Fourniret, was convicted for her role in the decades-old murders of 20-year-old British student Joanna Parrish and a nine-year-old girl.

title: French sports retailer acknowledges secretly supplying Russia
description: The retailer Decathlon has continued to sell sportswear in Russia even though it officially pulled out because of the war in Ukraine, the investigative website Disclose revealed.

title: Zelensky says 'no one knows' when war in Ukraine will end
description: Speaking to journalists, President Volodymyr Zelensky said he had turned down a request from the army to mobilize 500,000 more Ukrainians, and that he wants talks with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban to 'find solutions' about EU aid.

title: Historian Jean-Jacques Kourliandsky: 'It is the economic weapon that is favored by the US in Latin America'
description: 200 years after the speech made byPresident James Monroe, the historian Jean-Jacques Kourliandsky retraces how US imperialism has asserted itself in the south of the continent.

title: Paris hotels angry over tourist tax hike ahead of 2024 Olympics
description: The government is set to triple the tax paid by visitors on nights at hotels, which currently ranges from €0.25 to €5 a night.

title: Spanish journalist accuses Gérard Depardieu of rape
description: Ruth Baza filed a complaint with Spanish police saying the French actor raped her during an interview in Paris in 1995.

title: General Gadi Eisenkot's difficult balancing act in Israel's war cabinet
description: The former chief of staff invented the Dahiya doctrine, according to which civilian areas where armed movements are based must be targeted by a disproportionate response if they attack Israel. Eisenkot also is open to discussing the post-war period from a political perspective.

title: Europe increasingly critical of Israel's military operation in Gaza
description: Faced with the relentless loss of civilian life in the Palestinian enclave, Germany, the United Kingdom and France have become increasingly open in their criticism of Israel.

title: Le Pen to back Macron's immigration bill
description: The leader of the far right said she will support the bill, after the governing coalition found a compromise with the right-wing Les Républicains. The government's draft had been rejected by the Assemblée Nationale without a debate, last week.

title: Iceland's striking volcanic eruption
description: The local police said that the population was not in danger in the current state of the eruption, which took place north of the town of Grindavik.

title: Blessing same-sex couples: The bold pragmatism of Pope Francis
description: By changing the Catholic Church's practice toward gay and lesbian couples, the pontiff is disassociating himself from his predecessors' condemnations of homosexuality.

title: French government battles to save flagship immigration bill
description: After the government bill was rejected by parliament last week, a commission of MPs and Senators began work on Monday to find a compromise text. They suspended their session after midnight without a breakthrough before resuming in the morning.

title: The challenges facing the new anti-Houthi coalition in the Red Sea
description: According to the Pentagon, 10 countries – including the US, France and the UK – are forming a naval task force designed to counter Yemeni rebel attacks on ships transiting the Bab Al-Mandab strait.

title: 'Take this pill, it'll help you steal and you'll have money:' The child trafficking web behind the petty thieves of Paris' Trocadéro
description: The trial of six Algerians accused of plying dozens of unaccompanied Moroccan minors with psychotropic drugs, in order to coerce them into robbing passers-by, opened in Paris on December 14.

title: The second passing of 1980s design pioneer Terence Conran
description: The closure of The Conran Shop in Paris marks the end of the legacy of the British father of consumer design, who died in 2020.

title: Texas governor signs bill that lets police arrest migrants who illegally cross US border
description: Taking effect in March, the new law allows any Texas law enforcement officer to arrest anyone suspected of entering the country illegally. As many as 12,000 immigrants per day cross the US southern border, overwhelming immigration authorities.

title: Jonathan Majors dropped by Marvel after assault conviction
description: Best known as Kang the Conqueror, the rising star was found guilty on Monday of assaulting and harassing his former girlfriend.

title: Iceland volcano erupts after weeks of earthquakes
description: Ahead of what the prime minister described as a 'considerable eruption', authorities had evacuated the nearly 4,000 inhabitants of the fishing town of Grindavik.

title: 'Flantophilia,' or how eating a flan can become an 'absolute pleasure'
description: Forget the bland industrial dessert with its artificial flavors, colorings, gelling agents and modified starch. Instead, search for the quintessence of this pastry speciality, a simple treasure whose success is rooted in childhood.

title: On board the Paris-Berlin night train: Is the European sleeper reawakening?
description: The return of the nighttime service after a nine-year hiatus is part of a global drive to revive sleeper trains to reduce the environmental impact of travel.

title: Neo-Nazi leaflets in southern France spark outrage and indifference
description: In the small town of Quissac, the Republican rally launched by radical left MP Michel Sala after anti-Semitic and homophobic flyers were discovered in letterboxes in late November, failed to rally residents in numbers.

title: After Hamas attack, residents of Kfar Aza kibbutz now mourn their dead killed by Israeli army
description: The community was particularly hard hit by the Hamas attack on October 7, and two of its members, who were taken hostage in Gaza, have just been killed by Israeli soldiers.

title: The 'wazalendo,' 'patriots' at war in eastern DRC
description: These militiamen are ready to fight the M23 rebels alongside the Congolese army and support the re-election of Félix Tshisekedi.

title: The mystery of morning sickness finally solved
description: A consortium of international researchers has uncovered the workings of a hormone involved in this symptom, opening the way to treatment for pregnant women affected by hyperemesis gravidarum.

title: In India, the opposition is being steamrolled by Narendra Modi's party
description: With just a few months to go before the spring 2024 general elections, Rahul Gandhi's Congress Party will have to make a considerable effort to take on the almighty prime minister's Indian People's Party.
